p: Morbillivirus transmission is thought to occur mostly after the inhalation of aerosolized virus shed by infected individuals [ 113]. This horizontal transmission is likely to occur among cetaceans too and to be favored by a gregarious behavior and a high density of cetaceans [ 67, 114]. Transmission by inhalation of expired blowhole droplets possibly occurs during breathing in a synchronized fashion when large numbers of tightly grouped cetaceans are travelling and feeding together or are engaged in social activities [ 20, 115, 116].
